repository.corpname: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

did.abstract: Consists of Toni Morrison's writings (manuscripts, drafts, galleys, and proofs), published books, working files, teaching files, correspondence, research files, press, photographs, awards, and memorabilia.

scopecontent.p: Consists of Toni Morrison's writings (manuscripts, drafts, galleys, etc.), published books, working files, teaching files, correspondence, research files, student papers, awards, interviews, press, and memorabilia.

accessrestrict.p: Most of the collection is open for research. Toni Morrison's manuscript material, including drafts, typescripts, galleys, and proofs, are available only via digital access in the reading room.

phystech.p: Some material in this collection, particularly found in Series 1: Writings and Series 2: Correspondence, was damaged by the fire that destroyed Morrison's upstate New York home in 1993. Damage ranges from charred edges to pages missing significant portions or rendered illegible.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. No further photoduplication of copies of material in the collection can be made when Princeton University Library does not own the original. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Associate University Librarian for Rare Books and Special Collections. The library has no information on the status of literary rights in the collection and researchers are responsible for determining any questions of copyright.

prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Toni Morrison Papers, Box and Folder Number; Department of Rare Books and Special Collections, Princeton University Library.

processinfo.p: Some materials in this collection were treated for fire damage and encapsulated in mylar in 1994.
This collection was processed by Allison Hughes in 2015. Finding aid written by Allison Hughes in 2015.

scopecontent.p: Consists of research material, notes, outlines, drafts, galleys, and proofs. Yellow legal notepads contain notes, early draft material, and inserts for later typed and printed versions. Notepads are identified by their first lines, though a single notepad may contain a variety of material, including material relating to other works, correspondence drafts, and other unrelated notes. Corrected typescript and printout drafts often show significant revisions. Material from various stages of the publication process is present, including setting copies with copy-editor's and typesetter's marks, galleys, page proofs, F&Gs (folded and gathered pages not yet bound), blueline proofs ("confirmation blues"), advance copies (bound uncorrected proofs) and production/design material with page and dust-jacket samples.
All of Morrison's novels except Song of Solomon are represented (this material was likely destroyed in the 1993 fire).
For the short story "Two of Eves," an early version of The Bluest Eye, see Subseries 2: Short Fiction.

accessrestrict.p: Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

accessrestrict.p: Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

scopecontent.p: As "Notes for Proposal" indicates, A Mercy was originally conceived of as a 3-part novel, later becoming a trilogy including Home and God Help the Child; early outlines and drafts thus include material relating to all three novels.

scopecontent.p: Written with Slade Morrison and illustrated by Giselle Potter. Contains typescript and printout drafts with revisions and page proofs.
Written with Slade Morrison and illustrated by Pascal Lemaitre. Contains autograph legal pad and printout drafts, oversize artwork, and page proofs.

Written with Slade Morrison and illustrated by Pascal Lemaitre. Series of retold Aesop's fables including Ant or the Grasshopper? (2003), Lion or the Mouse? (2003), Poppy or the Snake? (2003), published individually and as a 3-story compilation in 2005; Tortoise or the Hare? (2010). Autograph legal pad drafts, printouts with revisions, oversize artwork and page proofs. Also includes notes, drafts, and sketches for story ideas never published, including The Mirror or the Glass? and a version of "The Goose who Laid the Golden Eggs."

Drafts, proofs, and publication material relating to two works by Bambara edited and published posthumously by Morrison: Deep Sightings and Rescue Missions: Fiction, Essays, and Conversations (1998) and These Bones Are Not My Child (working title: Ground Cover) (1999); as well as Morrison's Random House author file on Bambara, circa 1970-1980 and correspondence between Bambara and Melvin Wilk, dating from 1960-1995.
